problem: In a right triangle, if one angle measures 45 degrees and one leg measures 7√2 units, find the length of the hypotenuse.
solution: In a 45-45-90 triangle, the legs are congruent and the hypotenuse is $\sqrt{2}$ times the length of each leg. Thus, the hypotenuse is $7\sqrt{2} \times \sqrt{2} = 14$ units. \(\boxed{14}\)
